column5: hey guys,  i've been thinkin since i moved to the soo..... are there any charter services out on lake superior that are close to sault ste. marie?  if there are can anyone suggest one? im just lookin to get out on a charter boat to go get some salmon next year or maybe a different species.  im not too comfortable takin the 14' tinner out there.  thanks,  JP

Goulais and Haviland bays in the spring if you go out on the good days are fine for a 14' tinner. I used to do it all the time. Thats where the salmon are in the spring. Summer, I don't think you will find them in the lake.
there isnt much that i'm aware of in sault ontario. theres a couple different charters out of sault michigan, i dont remember the names, do a google search.
i think there's a charter out of batchewana area.
well, i seen redwood charters one day in the phone book but i dont know where they are or if their still around.
i'd recommend a pair of waders, and a day out of the river with a guide.  that would open up all sorts of year round fishing opportunity for you.
well... do you feel like guiding me? haha. just kiddin, but have you heard of redwood charters?

I have been with redwood before...(I won the trip)  they were real good...cought lots of chinnies, and a pike...we were fishing the garden though...they did givbe me the option of what i wanted to go for.

John Giuliani guides on the river for steelhead, atlantics, walleye and pacific salmon. He's in the phonebook. About the best guy for salmonids in the st marys.  A few other guys come up from the states during various salmon runs, Brad Patzke (sp?) is one who has good reviews.   Chris McMillian guides also walleye in the river.  I believe I directed you here before, bottom of the page
